item.title: Kubernetes 1.8: Using Cronjobs to take Neo4j backups
item.description: With the release of Kubernetes 1.8 Cronjobs have graduated to beta, which means we can now more easily run Neo4j backup jobs against Kubernetes clusters. Before we learn how to write a Cronjob let’s first create a local Kubernetes cluster and deploy Neo4j. Spinup Kubernetes & Helm minikube start --memory 8192 helm init && kubectl rollout status -w deployment/tiller-deploy --namespace=kube-system Deploy a Neo4j cluster helm repo add incubator https://kubernetes-charts-incubator.
